movie_title: Why Your Brain Blinds You For 2 Hours Every Day
introduction: Go to https://brilliant.org/nutshell/ to dive deeper into these topics and more with a free 30-day t

vocabulary.definition: to build or create something, typically something abstract
vocabulary.example: Your brain constructs your reality as you are experiencing it.

vocabulary.definition: rapid movements of the eye between fixation points
vocabulary.example: Each second your eyes make 3 to 4 sudden saccades, focusing from one point to another.

vocabulary.definition: happening, existing, or done at the same time
vocabulary.example: You don’t experience them separately but as one smooth, simultaneous and connected moment.

vocabulary.definition: a device used for measuring or maintaining orientation and angular velocity
vocabulary.example: As your foot catches the peel, the gyroscope inside your ears notices a sudden change of your position in space.

vocabulary.definition: a prediction of what will happen in the future
vocabulary.example: You get hungry or tired because your brain assumes this is the time when this is needed, a self-fulfilling prophecy.

vocabulary.definition: to cover part of the same area of interest, responsibility, etc.
vocabulary.example: Your conscious self and your brain overlap in decision-making processes.
